title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab.
description: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no listing of children nodes. This results in no database/table/column information being displayed. Closing the data set editor and reopening it does not resolve the issue.
OB: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab.
EB: Children nodes should be listed when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab. All relevant database/table/column information should be displayed.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.
2. Go to the data set editor page and navigate to the data source page.
3. Change the data source.

Expected result:
- Children nodes should be listed when changing data source.
- All relevant database/table/column information should be displayed.
